extendedInfo.description: Warmly is a simple, friendly way to start your day.Wake up gently with the calm sounds of weather and something you enjoy (like cooking breakfast, brewing coffee, or catching a plane). Just set the time you want to get up and Warmly will plan ahead to make stepping out of bed enjoyable.A few minutes before your alarm is set to go off, Warmly will get the weather for your location and begin quietly playing ambient sounds. Warmly starts out silent and very gradually turns up the volume so you'll wake up naturally to the sounds of the day and the activity you selected.Warmly is great as a motivational alarm clock that gets you out of bed naturally. Get a great night's sleep and wake up ready to do awesome things!***HTC USERS!!!Some users have experienced issues with their phones not waking from sleep to allow the alarm to go off. You may want to set a backup alarm just in case for the first couple days to make sure your device isn't affected.We're continuing to look into the issue. Thanks for your patience. If it continues to not work for you, email us at hello@chaoscollective.org***THINGS TO KNOW BEFORE YOU BUYWarmly is unlike other alarm clocks; it's designed to be super simple and encourage healthy sleep habits. â Warmly slowly fades in over 5 minutes. This is great to wake up to, but a bit tricky to test by setting the alarm a minute from now and tapping ok.â Warmly has a persistent notification so you know when the alarm is set. This is the suggested android model for alarm clocks, but some may find it annoying. We're sorry. ***HOW TO CHANGE FROM Â°F TO Â°CWhen the alarm goes off, simply tap on the temperature to toggle between Â°F and Â°C. Presto! And your selection will be remembered for next time.***WARMLY FEATURESâ Select from 9 activity sound tracks to start your day: making breakfast, having coffee, cartoon news, working out, zen meditation, a cat, a dog, flying at the airport, and taking a train or subway. â Press and hold on an activity to preview the track.â Integrated local weather when your alarm begins to fade in.â Slow wake-up gradually turns up the volume of weather and activity audio over time.â Simple user interface makes setting the time and selecting activities fast and intuitive.â Change between Fahrenheit and Celsius temperature view by tapping on the weather information.â Vibration used as a last resort, in case you leave your headphones plugged in.â 12-hour and 24-hour clock mode support.â Snooze (9 min increments) while alarm is sounding.â Nice to neighbors: auto-silence after 15 minutes of loudest alarm (in case you leave it on and aren't around).***Warmly is built with love by The Chaos Collective in Seattle, Wa. and Luxembourg.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: The only problem I have is that I seem to be woken by the \"weather\" sounds before my selected sound has even played.  Some way to make the weather quieter or come in later would be useful.  Otherwise, a nice execution but a few more sounds would be good.
reviews.author: Miles Gilmour

reviews.title: Great, but could be better
reviews.comment: It\'s a great app, my default alarm since purchased. Nevertheless, lacks some important features, even for a so called simple alarm, being the most important the option to set multiple alarms, as weekends and week days. It\'s really annoying having to set the alarm on weekends and risk forgetting to set on Sunday for the rest of the week
reviews.author: Giovanni Naufal

reviews.title: HTC workaround
reviews.comment: I really like this creative alarm so was disappointed when I discovered it doesn\'t work on HTC phones overnight. But I discovered a workaround that will allow Warmly to work.  HTC owners please try the following. Set an alarm with stock alarm for about 10 minutes before your Warmly is set to go off. Have the alarm play \"silent\" alarm tone and shut vibration off. The stock alarm will wake your phone up silently and allow Warmly to work.
reviews.author: Scott Walker

reviews.title: Jimmy
reviews.comment: Great idea... but.  There are only nine sounds to choose from.  The only sound loud enough to wake me is the eggs and bacon.  I really enjoy the app, but I would like  an update with more options.
reviews.author: Jimmy Broomfield

reviews.title: Needs improvement
reviews.comment: Thank goodness for the time zone update. I just got woken up at the wrong time zone this morning. That was upsetting.   Please have more options like having different timers, weekend mode, etc.
reviews.author: Jianhui Ho

reviews.title: Well worth downloading
reviews.comment: This is a wonderful app but it needs improving - I\'d like to see controls for volume and the length of time of each alarm phase. It would be nice if you could add custom sounds too.
reviews.author: Claire Brown

reviews.title: Nice App but...
reviews.comment: ... the permanent notification is annoying and can\'t be turned off.
reviews.author: Edouard Breine

reviews.title: Simple and effective. Love this app for it.
reviews.comment: Keep working on a perfect experience (screen lock, app size, move to storage) and don\'t get carried away with features. Thanks!
reviews.author: Guto Motta

reviews.comment: The best way to wake up in the morning
reviews.author: Michelle Pedicone

reviews.title: So far so good
reviews.comment: I\'m enjoying the experience so far. A little more variety in sounds would be great. The meditation sound has been waking me up nicely. I would like some monastic chanting/singing in Latin or Greek or some of the more standard nature sounds like birds or something. Rainforest or ocean sounds would be nice. Something a little less urban. Thanks.
reviews.author: Kent Thiessen

reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
reviews.comment: I was slightly suspicious of this little app\'s performance in terms of how it avoids being annoying without monitoring our REM and non-REM cycles. But it works! The featured sounds truly gives you a natural wake up call. Love it!
reviews.author: Bryan Ng

reviews.title: Headphone override
reviews.comment: Like the app but I also like to fall asleep listening to music via headphones. I\'d love if this app played via my external speaker regardless of have headphones plugged in.
reviews.author: Lee Brown

reviews.title: Works great but...
reviews.comment: If there was an option to turn off the notification icon it would be the perfect alarm for me.
reviews.author: hamza asif

reviews.title: Bugs fixes, I like it!
reviews.comment: **Edit: alright the app was updated and the timing is normal so thanks for doing that!
reviews.author: David McGowan

reviews.title: Really like it, but...
reviews.comment: It\'d be nice if there was multi alarm support. Some more sounds, maybe some Gregorian/monastic chanting would be really good too. Great app otherwise!
reviews.author: Karthik Chandran

reviews.title: Prefect alarm
reviews.comment: This alarm app wakes me up to new sounds every morning and I love it. The sizzling of breakfast being made or the coffee being done, is way better than the annoying normal alarms. Works like a charmalarm! ;-)
reviews.author: Lars Bergan

reviews.title: A little incomplete
reviews.comment: Would like more sounds, an option to turn the notification icon off and a little color variation. It\'s getting there
reviews.author: Adam Flint

reviews.title: Room for improvement
reviews.comment: Was excited at first and the UI is nice, but disappointed in the sounds. I\'d expected relaxing sound loops more like the Ambience app; these seem too jarring.
reviews.author: Michael Downey
